channel.title: Anyone have an idea of the PC requirements for Black Mesa Source?
channel.description:
It looks extremely detailed and I have a pretty good computer.
Intel Quad Core
Nvidia GeForce GT220 1024 MB
Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit.

item.source: Anyone have an idea of the PC requirements for Black Mesa Source?

item.title: Anyone have an idea of the PC requirements for Black Mesa Source?
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
rx33gundam:

That won’t be enough. Black Mesa features the source engine 2. It also features destructible environments and bending of metals without cinematic physics.

You need OctaCore

Nvidia GeForece GT9999 5GB

Windows 8 800-bit.

:retard:

Oh come on, you didn’t even make anything fit a valid number scheme.

NVidia wouldn’t just use “9999”, they’ll probably go to the 6xx series, then 8xx, then roll over to the 4-digit numbering system again.

5GB and 800-bit also aren’t powers of 2 or combinations of them. It’d probably be 4096MB or 5120MB or something. I’m not even going to address what’s wrong with “800-bit”.

Besides, that’s STILL not even CLOSE to enough power to run Black Mesa.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone have an idea of the PC requirements for Black Mesa Source?
item.dc:creator: rx33gundam
item.description:
Lamp:

It looks extremely detailed and I have a pretty good computer.

Intel Quad Core

Nvidia GeForce GT220 1024 MB

Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit.

That won’t be enough. Black Mesa features the source engine 2. It also features destructible environments and bending of metals without cinematic physics.

You need OctaCore

Nvidia GeForece GT9999 5GB

Windows 8 800-bit.

:retard:

item.title: Anyone have an idea of the PC requirements for Black Mesa Source?
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

If you can run HL2 you won’t have any problem.

Really?

Raminator:

If you have trouble running Episode Two, Black Mesa’s going to be even worse.
